text: - My name is Kayla

and I am an engineering
operation technician.
I was coming from the fitness industry.
I was working as reception

and I decided to kind of
take an interest in IT.

And I thought, why not
try to get an internship
at Amazon in their IT department.
I did receive an email from a recruiter

about a new program that
they were enrolling.
I did not need any technical experience.

It was more so a 'learn on
the job' type of situation.
When I think of data centers,

I more so think of a
commercial that I saw on TV,

and it was a room full
of servers with lights.

But, coming into the position,
you do get that aspect
but there's a lot more that goes into it.
The servers is kind of the storefront
but there's so much more behind it.
So my day-to-day really involves
the behind the scenes of the servers.
So I don't work so much with the servers
but what keeps the servers running.

So we have our AC, our HVAC,
our ventilation, our cooling.
So I'm more so walking around the building
maintaining it to make sure
that everything is running properly.

I think AWS is a great place
for me to grow my career.

There are so many avenues
that I didn't even know myself
before joining Amazon.

I wasn't even aware of AWS
before I joined this position.

Once you're inside and you
go to your career pages

and you see all the different
positions and departments
I was astonished

because it's honestly a second
world inside of the company.

My dream is to work in
the fashion industry.
Starting in the data center,

and transitioning into
fashion is fairly simple,

especially because they have
so many technical jobs as well.

So, you can actually
slowly do a transition

if you'd like, and find
the IT opportunities.

So, helping run Amazon Fashion
online, the Amazon Prime,

the shopping experience, and
become a personal stylist.
So there are ways that you can kind of

incorporate your prior job
into your interested new job.
AWS is definitely
a stepping stone
where once you get your foot in the door
you can get so much experience, so fast.

It's literally a pathway
to so many opportunities
and there's so much support behind it.
